definition: to show consideration for (others)/to yield to (another vehicle etc)/courtesy/comity
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: When two cars pass each other, both drivers should politely give way.
sentences.chinese: 当两辆汽车会车时，司机要互相礼让通行。

sentences.english: Yield to vehicles who have the right of way.
The basic feature of positive comity is its voluntariness.
sentences.chinese: 积极礼让的基本特征是它的自愿性。

sentences.english: More cars yielding to pedestrians on the road.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的汽车学会在道路上礼让行人。
礼让有助于更安全驾驶。

sentences.english: Let those who are older go first, the younger ones should follow behind.
sentences.chinese: 总是礼让长辈在先，晚辈居后。

definition: to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
pedestrian/traveler on foot/passer-by/official responsible for arranging audiences with the emperor
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to yield to one another/mutual accommodation
to break the rules/to violate regulations
